paragraphs.name: 1c34
paragraphs.text: “You’ve got two playoff teams [in every series], as simple as that sounds,” ESPN NBA analyst P.J. Carlesimo told me. “People say, ‘What’s different about the playoffs?’ Well, guess what? You’re not playing the 14 teams that are under .500.”

4413dc447ab1.title: “rules remain the same, but more rest, more prep time, and more talent”… Motivation is another big…

paragraphs.name: 9d47
paragraphs.text: “rules remain the same, but more rest, more prep time, and more talent”… Motivation is another big factor. Most players know they must give max effort throughout the playoffs…or be exposed. ….There are only a select number of guys (Westbrook, Butler, Leonard, etc.) who also put in playoff-caliber effort in every minute of every game they play in the regular season.

virtuals.subtitle: Basic as street ball: I know your tricks, you know mine, who can do what they want to do? I think this is elemental motivation to the best…

73879b20eba0.title: Ignoring the style of officiating and added rest in the playoffs (which are both huge), the biggest…

content.subtitle: Basic as street ball: I know your tricks, you know mine, who can do what they want to do? I think this is elemental motivation to the best…

paragraphs.name: 9e5f
paragraphs.text: Ignoring the style of officiating and added rest in the playoffs (which are both huge), the biggest difference is the repeated meetings between the same clubs.
Basic as street ball: I know your tricks, you know mine, who can do what they want to do? I think this is elemental motivation to the best players, the crowd gets it…

1c552f920b4d.title: I feel like as though the lack of calls by the referees hurt DeRozan as well.

paragraphs.name: 16d8
paragraphs.text: I feel like as though the lack of calls by the referees hurt DeRozan as well. They are less prone to give him those “back to the basket” pump fakes that take him to the line, and have seen him being fouled on jumpers but the calls come less often because playoff basketball is refed a little differently than a regular 82 game season.

paragraphs.name: bec3
paragraphs.text: I Luv this article — Fantastic work! Michael Jordan avg 10 FTA’s per game but could never find success in the playoffs against Great teams. He found the key to maximizing his gifts & that was to get his teammates involved, keep the game close & THEN take over in the last 5 min of the 4th qtr. Another great example of why Elite athletic explosiveness…

96012eed2fc2.title: Interesting article and all elements seem to make a lot of sense.

paragraphs.name: aa28
paragraphs.text: Interesting article and all elements seem to make a lot of sense. One aspect that was not discussed was the angle where trade line acquisitions factor into the mix. Toronto with the additions of Ibaka & Tucker and the Cavs with the addition of Korver change each teams dynamic heading into the playoffs. Both acquisitions give both teams substantially…

bb0694417c61.title: Conventional wisdom is that the refs call less of the ballhandler “flops” (when the offensive…

paragraphs.text: Conventional wisdom is that the refs call less of the ballhandler “flops” (when the offensive player dives into his defender and falls over while hoisting a wild shot) in the playoffs. It will be interesting to see if this wisdom holds true this season. Look no further than the first round match up between Houston and OKC, which features two of the…

876be17f3c4e.title: O’Hanlon: Seems like you’re primarily a soccer guy, but solid NBA stuff — keep it up!

paragraphs.text: O’Hanlon: Seems like you’re primarily a soccer guy, but solid NBA stuff — keep it up!

e44182a17d98.title: Teams with the biggest stars “overachieve” in the playoffs because suddenly those stars use the…

paragraphs.name: fac0
paragraphs.text: Teams with the biggest stars “overachieve” in the playoffs because suddenly those stars use the extra rest to play 4–8 more minutes a game. Kyrie is “better” because everyone’s better next to LeBron and he’s next to LeBron a lot more in the playoffs. Teams like Boston and San Antonio that rely on depth for regular season dominance don’t have that extra playoff gear.

ae771e2fc3b6.title: Raps’ Casey is not a good strategic coach.

paragraphs.name: 526b
paragraphs.text: Raps’ Casey is not a good strategic coach. You can see evidence of it almost every time they come out of a time-out in critical situations. Switch coaches with Boston and the Raps win the East this year.

48cc44072b2b.title: Playoff-LeBron will always be one of the most dominating forces in the sport.

paragraphs.name: 1adc
paragraphs.text: Playoff-LeBron will always be one of the most dominating forces in the sport. He’s at that point in his career where he just knows when he has to turn up the heat. Aside from him and maybe Coach Pop, I don’t believe much else with the whole postseason mantra.

557819b03afb.title: I put this quote up there with “You have to score more points than the other team to win”

paragraphs.name: 152c
paragraphs.text: I put this quote up there with “You have to score more points than the other team to win”
